result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian Manuel Santiago-Maldonado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $2,129.00 to Judy MR uncharge case.  Joint and several with Raymond Dejesus 14CF438.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.

Provide DNA sample. Pay mandatory DNA  surcharge, all court costs, fees and surcharges.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIBATIONS:  25% of prison funds collected by DOC to apply to restitution first, all other monetary obligations thereafter.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Payment plan for all monetary obligations to be established by DOC.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.  No possession, consumption, selling, distributing, being in the vicinity of illegal drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victims Hazel C., Radio Shack 14CF439, Judy MR and family in uncharged case.
Pay all applicable fees of supervision.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemd necessary by he State of Wisconsin DOC.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens if deemed appropriate.

Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and DOC.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag

Defendant Christian Manuel Santiago-Maldonado in court with attorney Gregory R Parr.  Defendant Christian Manuel Santiago-Maldonado in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was NOTordered. Case set for sentencing in Branch 22.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-30-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory R Parr in court, defendant Christian Manuel Santiago-Maldonado not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 04-18-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christian Manuel Santiago-Maldonado in court with attorney Gregory R Parr.  Defendant Christian Manuel Santiago-Maldonado in custody.  Jacob Corr for Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with HAZEL C. OR ANY RADIO SHACK IN MILWAUKEE COUNTY.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christian Manuel Santiago-Maldonado in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Christian Manuel Santiago-Maldonado in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
